templates.title: MariaDB
templates.description: MariaDB v10.6+ Container with default settings
templates.notes: Valid MariaDB image versions are listed on the [Docker hub](https://hub.docker.com/_/mariadb)

env.name: CONTAINER_NAME
env.label: Container name
env.description: Container name (for docker, unlike 'Name' above which is only used by Portainer to manage displayed stacks)

env.name: MYSQL_VERSION
env.label: MariaDB version
env.description: Version (see list of valid image versions on the MariaDB Docker Hub at https://hub.docker.com/_/mariadb)

env.name: MYSQL_DATABASE
env.label: Database name(s)
env.description: Space-separated list of database names to create

env.name: MYSQL_PORT
env.label: Port
env.description: Port to use for the database instance (check that it is not in use)

env.name: MOUNT_ROOT
env.label: Mount root
env.description: Optional, Path on host to use for the persistent data directory. Data files will be stored in the mount root under the ./container-name/data subdirectory. For linux, `/var/lib/portainer` is recommended.

env.name: MYSQLD_PARAMETERS
env.label: Optional parameters
env.description: Optional parameters to the mariadbd daemon such as `--skip-grant-tables` or `--sql_mode=NO_ENGINE_SUBSTITUTION`

templates.title: NGINX-PHP
templates.notes: Valid PHP/NGINX image versions are listed on the [Docker hub](https://hub.docker.com/r/trafex/php-nginx)

env.name: CONTAINER_NAME
env.label: Container name
env.description: Container name (for docker, unlike 'Name' above which is only used by Portainer to manage displayed stacks)

env.name: VERSION
env.label: Trafex version
env.description: Version (see list of valid image versions on the Trafex Docker Hub at https://hub.docker.com/r/trafex/php-nginx/tags)

env.name: TRAFEX_PORT
env.label: Port
env.description: Port to use for the php server (check that it is not in use)

env.name: PHP_WEB_ROOT
env.label: Mount root
env.description: Path on host to use for the PHP application root.

env.name: RESTART
env.label: Restart
env.description: Restart behavior (on failure or Docker engine restart)
